content.description: Face climb past the bolt and make a 'walrus move' on to the ledge.  From there, continue up and left in the thin hand crack dihedral to the anchor.  Good rock.
content.protection: Bolt, gear to 2", 2 bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: Just left of the main Washboard Area.  Start beneath a bulge and a left facing/left arching crack.

content.description: Follow the dihedral to a traverse left on pockets.  Some face moves then lead you to the right angling roof crack.  Follow it up and right to the anchor, never really pulling the roof, though.  Good rock.
content.protection: Bolts.  2 bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: In the middle of the Washboard Area.  The line follows the dihedral, then the right angling roof crack.  Start on ledge above the belay ledge.

content.description: Climb the face to the base of the roof.  Pull into the chimney, then right around the corner to the face.  Climb up to a ledge hight on the route.  Pull the final moves on a face to clip the anchors.  Good rock.
content.protection: Bolts, 2 bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: Near the left end of the Washboard Area.  Starts beneath the low roof with a wide crack/chimney running through it.  A dihedral crack system runs above this.

content.description: Start on a ledge above the belay, clipping a bolt from it.  Then head straight up on slopers, going left after 3 or 4 bolts.  This joins Gary's Route after 4 bolts.  Good rock.
content.protection: 6 bolts, 2 bolt anchor on the flat top.  Rap, lower, or walkoff.
content.location: In the middle of the Washboard Area, just left of the large dihedral system that is Gary's Route.

content.description: Climb the face of Brooks and Spiders From Mars.  Then "either squirm through the chimney, or heel hook and stem out left on good holds to the first independent bolt."  From there, continue up the face to a beautiful short vertical face at the top.  Good rock.  The middle section isn't awesome quality, but not too bad.
content.protection: 9 bolts, 2 bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: At the left end of the Washboard Area.  Start beneath the low roof crack/chimney that is Brooks and Spiders From Mars.

content.description: Face climb on mostly good rock, weaving close to and farther away from the dihedral.  Pull into and around the right side of another small dihedral at the very top.  Good rock.
content.protection: 6 bolts, 2 bolt anchor.  Rap, lower, or walk off.
content.location: In the middle of the Washboard Area, just right of the large dihedral.

content.description: This is a 2 bolt variation for the start of Freefall Cafe.  Thin face climbing for 10 feet or so.  Good rock, though those crimps seem like they may peel off someday.
content.protection: Bolts, 2 bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: Starts on the small ledge just left of Freefall Cafe, at a bolt clippable from the ledge.

content.description: Face/slab climbing, pulling left over a small bulge near the top.  Pretty good rock.
content.protection: 5 bolts, 2 bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: On the right end of the Washboard Area.  Start in a dihedral/chimney thing.

content.description: Face climb to a ledge with a tree.  OK rock.
content.protection: #3 or 3.5 camalot.  Rap off a tree.
content.location: 10 feet right of Freefall Cafe.  Starts right behind a tree.

content.description: Start in a left facing dihedral, pulling the roof and heading up and right.  Follow the slab to the left arching hand crack roof.  Follow this up and left to the anchors.  Good rock.
content.protection: Bolts, 2 bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: On the right end of the Washboard Area.  This line pulls the right side of the low roof, then aiming for the right arching hand crack at the top.

content.description: Start either left of the bolt or on Disco Inferno, then hand traverse under the line.  Crunch up under the roof and explode over it on slopers (you heard me).  After that is a bit of easy slab.  At the headwall, head left, then back right to the anchors.  Good rock.
content.protection: 6 bolts, 2 bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: This route is just left of Disco Inferno and pulls the middle of the low roof.

content.description:
5.11a-c, depending on the holds used.  Traditionally 11c, though. 

  Good rock and fun face moves take you up the face and between the large bulges at the top.
content.protection: Bolts.  2 bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: Near the middle of the Washboard Area.  Start beneath the two bulges at the very top of the route that look like the route's namesake.

content.description: Climb the bolted face to the roof crack.  Pull into it and continue up the crack system to the anchors.  Mostly good rock.
content.protection: Bolts and gear to 3".  2 bolt anchor, if I remember right.  Rap or lower if there are.
content.location: Near the left end of the Washboard Area.  The same start as Spiders From Mars.  Start beneath the wide crack/chimney runing through a low roof.

content.description:
After a somewhat scabby start this line cleans up after the 2nd bolt . Techy and delicate, it doesn't let up till the chains. Similar in difficulty to Warrior Poet but more sustained. 

   [also makes for an interesting direct start to WP by stepping right into it at the final crack/bulge]
content.location: Between Cleavage and Warrior Poet, starting in a left facing white dihedral.

content.description: Directly left of the left/west walkdown, as seen from the water.
